author: Ryan McCann
comment: App connects my OG Moto watch to Tasker on my phone. I use it primarily to trigger tasks on the phone but it does so much more!

comment: This makes android wear awesome! great app, great tasker integration and even better development support.  the entire Auto Series makes Android better than the rest

comment: Thanks for the response Dev. :) I'll be giving this a better look now as tasker has been a life save alone

comment: Please make a Samsung Tizen version for Samsung gears

reply.content: thanks for the feedback! Unfortunately that's a whole other OS so it would be a lot of trouble. Maybe one day when Tizen has a bigger user base, thanks :)

comment: I use this constantly

comment: Works!

reply.author: joaomgcd
reply.content: Hi. What do you mean exactly? Do yo mean voice commands? What exactly is screwed up?

author: Mike Lierman
comment: Keeps flashing please wait screen over and over again. Had to uninstall to make my watch usable again

author: Joshua Horner
comment: I installed this hoping to add some cool features to my watch but All​ it did was constantly trigger the shake to talk even when not moving my wrist at all, essentially making my watch a useless bracelet that vibrates constantly. I assume they have not made this compatible with AW2.... wish there was a way I could use this because it seemed promising.  It took me some very tedious and careful work to uninstall it without triggering this ultra sensitive shake feature....

reply.author: joaomgcd
reply.content: Hi there. Did you set it up in the AutoWear settings app on your watch? You can set the shake sensitivity there as mentioned in the in-app tutorial. Thanks

author: Chris Dowsett
comment: No consistently. When I shake to wake the phone sees the log but the watch is not listening. When it dose work it's ace, just need it to work every time.
title: When it works it's ace. However

author: Tommy Haywood
comment: I specifically wanted a way of disabling always on display in the evening and in the car to save battery. Problem is that my watch is 2.0 with ambient display. This app just turns the display fully on or off rather than changing the native setting. Sad face

reply.author: joaomgcd
reply.content: Hi there. No where does it say that it can toggle that setting. Why the low rating if the app doesn't say it supports the feature? Can you clarify? Thanks

author: Rasmus Schøler Sørensen
comment: I've bought several of the author's Tasker plugins, and unfortunately they are all very rough, buggy, unpolished and generally difficult to use. This one in particular seems more like a "private alpha" than an app you would actually charge money for. The UI is very technical and essentially unusable without constantly referring to the "manual". For example: When creating a new notification, there is an input box labelled "Command". What do you think that covers? Is it a command that is sent to the watch? No. It is in fact used to specify a trigger event, i.e when this happens on your watch, the AutoWear action that you are currently configuring will be executed – independent of Tasker. In other words, "Command" can be "the screen turns on". In Tasker, this would be a "(trigger) Event" or profile "condition".

reply.author: joaomgcd
reply.content: You should run the "AutoWear Settings" app on your watch, not the "AutoWear" app. The "AutoWear" app is meant to be defined by the user. The "Settings" one is the one you want.

author: Chris Nash
comment: Used to be pretty robust but now it won't launch the voice screen 9 out of 10 whichever method I use. I get a pretty useless toast message saying the screen has launched and it never appears! May have to root and go back to my old method.
title: Inconsistent!

author: Ian Grody
comment: The fact this can be used alone or with tasker is a win in itself, but with tasker and the functionality on the watch just became endless. It's not for the non techie minded however, but, if you have the time and patience, it becomes a tool that leaves the watch naked without. Very few apps are an absolute must have for me and this is one of the absolute must haves. Setup properly and it works flawlessly. The developer also rocks.
title: Dependant on this now

author: Nova Leary
comment: The shake guesture hardly works and whenever I try to shake the watch while setting up the shake gesture, the app ends up getting closed. Also, the app seems to kill the battery on it extremely quick.. Had a 16% Idle and Screen usage since installing it yesterday (in about 5 hours it went from full charge to 10% with Ambient mode on while its normally 10 - 12 hours before it gets to 10% with Ambient mode on)
title: Cool but shake gestures are pretty unreliable on my Moto 360 2nd Gen with Android 6.0.1

author: Mark Ellis
comment: I have found some tutorial but nowhere near enough for the average user on all the different action, and how to use them. So looks like I will still need my crystal ball. Also it zaps the power in my Sony smartwatch 3, i easy lose 24 hours with this app installed.with only the basics being used.

reply.author: joaomgcd
reply.content: Have you looked in the help section in the app? Have you looked in the play store description? Or have you looked here? https://joaoapps.com/autowear/ thanks

author: Joshua Abramson
comment: I currently use AutoApps, AutoInput, AutoShare, AutoWear and AutoWeb.  I enjoy all of the AutoApps collection and my only complaint is that one can spend endless time tinkering with new automated solutions. Thanks João for the great app.

author: zingmars
comment: Doesn't seem to be too great for controlling the watch as the watch settings section is pretty bare and useless. The documentation also seems to be broken as it now opens Dropbox's file not found screen. And the UI could use some tuning as well, as it's pretty bad in some places.

comment: App no longer works as of wear 2.0 and it's been well over a year since the last update. This used to be the go to app to make cool things happen with your watch but now it can barely make basic notification screens happen.

reply.author: joaomgcd
reply.content: Sorry about that. I need to fix the app you're right. I hope you can come back after I've done it. Thanks!

title: Thank you for the update

reply.content: Sorry you feel that way, but AutoApps is simply an unlock key for all my other apps. Rather than having an unlock key for each separate app I decided to put them all in only place. Hope you understand.

author: Hector Mendes
comment: As usual, one more excellent AutoApp, you made it again Joao (você é foda!). I only noticed a potential bug, sometimes my lists won't appear, I've tried invoking AutoWear App in Tasker to launch the list screen, also tried starting lists right away in a Tasker task, it works 85% of the time, not sure why it won't appear sometimes. Using Nexus 5 Lollipop. Keep it up! Take care/Tudo de bom.
title: Amazing!

author: Niles Black
comment: This one app is more powerful and useful than every other app for Android Wear combined. Not even kidding. Hooking your watch into the power of Tasker makes it nearly as powerful as your phone, and being able to make layouts and screens that use HTML formatting trivially? Takes things to a whole new level. I've made so many things with this app, it's ridiculous. Main one was a cohesive control panel for Tasker, which was revolutionary for me. Seriously, wow. Bravo Joao.
title: Amazing

author: Tracey Janke
comment: Need to be a rocket scientist to even read the Instructions.  Don't even understand what I am supposed to be achieving.  Needs to be way better explained.  Uninstalled. Update - developer quick to contact me but have decided that the issue is more my I ability to understand the app rather than a problem with the app itself.  I am not the brightest and should not have taken it out on the developer.

reply.author: joaomgcd
reply.content: Hello, I'm sorry to hear that. What part didn't you understand?

title: I don't get this

author: Matthias -
comment: I'm really getting some great use out of this but I am noticing some bugs. Not big ones,  like floating icons randomly disappearing. A big one though is when there are floating icons on the screen,  touching anywhere else is highly inaccurate or doesn't work. I end up having to press around the normal buttons to find their hitbox as it moves around. With out the icons accuracy goes back to normal.
title: Awesome!

author: Michael Falack
comment: Had to Uninstall.  Watch battery was good for over 24hours then dropped to a mere 8 hours. This makes my watch useless and in turn rendering this app useless as well.  #TAGCONNECTED

author: Aaron Sutton
comment: Update: I've changed my rating to 4 stars, as the issues seem to have worked themselves out and the support provided by the developer was phenomenal.   I love tasker and the various plugins and was very excited for this. Have been using autovoice for quite some time. LG G Watch is connected to my Nexus 6. Autowear voice commands work but often take more than 30 seconds to execute. This makes autowear basically useless. Others on Reddit report the same issue.

reply.author: joaomgcd
reply.content: Hello. Sorry I haven't seen this issue before. Can you please contact me directly so I can try to fix it or direct me to the reddit post on this?

title: Voice command takes too long

author: Brian Pipia
comment: This app takes Wear abilities to a new level. Every time I get stumped trying to figure out a way to make my Moto 360 do what I want, I can get around the problem by making a screen. It would be really scary if I actually understood half of the power that Tasker and the auto series offered - endless possibilities...
title: Another awesome app from Joao!
